title: Project & Work Preferences
description: The types of projects, tasks, and activities that energize you

questions.question: What project duration do you prefer?

options.label: Short projects (1-2 weeks) - quick results and variety
Medium projects (1-2 months) - balanced depth and pace
Long-term projects (6+ months) - deep, sustained work
A mix of short and long-term projects

questions.question: Which types of projects excite you? (Select up to 4)

options.label: Starting something new from scratch
Improving and refining existing work or processes
Solving specific problems or fixing what's broken
Creating original content, designs, or ideas
Research, exploration, and discovering new approaches
Scaling and growing something that already works
Teaching, training, or sharing knowledge
Building systems, processes, or frameworks

questions.question: Do you prefer creating new things or improving existing ones?
questions.minLabel: I love creating new things from scratch
questions.maxLabel: I love improving and perfecting existing work

questions.question: What level of ownership do you want over your work?

options.label: Full ownership - I want to own it end-to-end
Shared ownership with a team
Clear tasks assigned to me with guidance
Flexible - depends on the project and my experience

questions.question: What aspects of work do you enjoy most? (Select up to 5)

options.label: Strategy and planning - designing the approach
Hands-on execution - doing the actual work
Quality review - ensuring everything meets standards
Coordination - keeping things organized and on track
People interaction - gathering feedback and collaborating
Peer review and mentoring others
Documentation and knowledge sharing
Diagnosing problems and finding root causes
Brainstorming and generating new ideas

questions.question: How much variety do you need in your daily tasks?
questions.minLabel: I thrive with consistent, focused work
questions.maxLabel: I need lots of variety and different activities

questions.question: When starting a new project, what excites you most?

options.label: The intellectual challenge and complexity
The impact it will have on others
The opportunity to learn something new
Starting fresh with a blank canvas
Collaborating with others on it
The satisfaction of completing and delivering it

questions.question: How comfortable are you handling urgent, unexpected situations that require quick action?
questions.maxLabel: I'm energized by urgent situations and thinking on my feet

questions.question: What gives you the most satisfaction when completing work?

options.label: Receiving positive feedback from others
Knowing the work is high quality and well-crafted
Having solved a difficult challenge
Achieving goals together with a team
Seeing measurable results and impact
What I learned and how I grew along the way

questions.question: What types of tasks drain your energy? (Select all that apply)

options.label: Too many meetings and discussions
Administrative work and paperwork
Working with outdated methods or tools
Unclear or constantly changing requirements
Excessive process and bureaucracy
Repetitive, routine tasks
Constantly switching between unrelated tasks
Constant crisis mode and firefighting

questions.question: Describe a project or activity you've worked on that felt most fulfilling (from school, work, volunteering, or personal life)
questions.placeholder: What were you doing? What was your role? What made it great?
